title: SeriouslyGiveaway
author: SeriouslyGiveaway
content: List of honest traders by Xunie in 2010.QuoteWe have some scammers on the forums here, so if you do not know if you can trust a person?Just check in the list here.If you got scammed? Please post here: Scammer accusationsPlease also post the traders you trust.If you've traded with someone before and everything went okay?Post his/her (nick) name here. (ofcourse, websites that accept Bitcoin payments are good too!)Anyhow, I'll start:BitcoinMarkettheymosedit: I trust Theymos and BitcoinMarket!theymos posted.QuoteAtlasBitcoinFXBrightAnarchist_DarK_Diablo-D3KeefeKibaNewLibertyStandardOneFixtXuniec3e0a4636987bcc7152e6b8b9127c4fe (PayPal MD5)dwdollar (Bitcoin Market)grondilujgarzik (Bitcoin Store)mtgoxnanotubesturlesxxmalouinxxPeople listed in bold had the opportunity to scam me for a large amount of money.Is it where theymos got idea and started to think of Trust system?Three years later, in 2013, he made Marketplace trust

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Quote from: SeriouslyGiveaway on September 08, 2023, 01:10:59 AMIs it where theymos got idea and started to think of Trust system?So it seems, the seed that culminated in the trust system, which was later modified, after that initial formulation. What I see in these threads is that it is a pity that there is no one left from the early years, from 2009-2012. From 2013 onwards I do remember seeing some accounts still active on the forum, but from the early years I think only theymos and I don't know if there are any others.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: I do not know the exact answer, as I registered here in 2021. But some old members of this forum might give you the correct answer. But, after reading the threads you provided, I can at least say Yes, these threads might provide the idea of a trust system to the moderators of the forum.I found it surprising that the trust system was not there from the start, as it must have been so difficult for the members to trade with each other back then. As of today, after reviewing the trust system of the member, we can deduce that either we should trade with him or not. This indicates that the forum is still growing, and there is plenty of room for it to grow and spread its legs.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.created_time: September 08, 2023, 04:42:02 AMLast edit: September 08, 2023, 11:25:05 AM by SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Don Pedro Dinero on September 08, 2023, 03:03:05 AMQuote from: SeriouslyGiveaway on September 08, 2023, 01:10:59 AMIs it where theymos got idea and started to think of Trust system?So it seems, the seed that culminated in the trust system, which was later modified, after that initial formulation. What I see in these threads is that it is a pity that there is no one left from the early years, from 2009-2012. From 2013 onwards I do remember seeing some accounts still active on the forum, but from the early years I think only theymos and I don't know if there are any others. I think there are some other users from that 2009-2012 era still active on this forum. I'm not sure about all those members but Flexystar and OgNasty are among the members from that era and they are still active on the forum. I'm not sure that how many of the old members are still active on this forum, but I'm quite sure that many of those members might visit the forum every once in a while.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Don Pedro Dinero on September 08, 2023, 03:03:05 AMFrom 2013 onwards I do remember seeing some accounts still active on the forum, but from the early years I think only theymos and I don't know if there are any others. There are more members other than theymos that registered prior to 2013 and are still active. You can find them on bpip https://bpip.org/Report?r=mostactivity
